intro: Parabenzoin praecox var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy parabenzoin, is a rare and distinctive plant species characterized by its pubescent, hairy leaves and stems. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is known for its unique scent, which is often described as spicy and woody. Its flowers are small and clustered, forming umbels that bloom in the early spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in certain regions.
